ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: truly man is ungrateful to his Lord
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That man is ungrateful to his Lord
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily man is most ungrateful to his Lord;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The human being is certainly ungrateful to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed man is very ungrateful towards his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, man is ungrateful to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely man is ungrateful to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely Man is ungrateful to his Lord,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! man is an ingrate unto his Lord
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: surely, man is ungrateful to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily man is Unto his Lord ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed man is ungrateful to his Lord,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly man is, to his Lord, ungrateful;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! Man (disbeliever) is ungrateful to his Lord;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, the human is ungrateful to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Indeed, the human being is ungrateful to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [100:6] Verily man, the disbeliever, is ungrateful to his Lord, thankless, denying [the reality of] His graces, exalted be He,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Man) i.e. the disbelieving man: Qurt Ibn 'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr; and it is also said it refers to Abu Hubahib (is an ingrate unto his Lord) He says: he is ungrateful for the blessings of his Lord; it is also said this means: He is disobedient of his Lord; and it is also said this means: he is stingy; and it is also said this means: he denies those who are dependent on him, starves his slaves, eats alone and does not give those who are his relatives among his folk.
